#cmsmasters_row_673c3146c9b1f0_31846300 {

	padding-bottom: 0px;

.book-box {
    float: left;
    -webkit-box-shadow: 0 1px 5px 0 rgb(0 0 0 / 30%);
    box-shadow: 0 1px 5px 0 rgb(0 0 0 / 30%);
    background: #fff;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
    width: 100%;
    position: relative;
    cursor: pointer;
}
.overlay-book div {
    text-align: center;
}

.thumb-book a {
    display: block;
}
.book-box img {
    width: 100%;
}

.overlay-book {
    position: absolute;
    top: 50%;
    left: 50%;
    transform: translate(-50%, -50%);
    color: #fff;
    padding: 10px 20px;
    font-size: 20px;
    text-align: center;
    width: 70%;
    z-index: 9;
}

.overlay-book h3 {
    font-size: 32px;
    color: #fff;
    font-weight: bold;
    line-height: 36px;
    Verdana, Geneva, font-family: sans-serif;
    text-shadow: 5px 4px 11px rgb(0 0 0 / 63%), 0 2px 5px rgb(0 0 0 / 84%);
}

.book-box:after {
    content: '\A';
    position: absolute;
    width: 100%;
    height:100%;
    top:0;
    left:0;
    background:rgba(0,0,0,0.6);
    opacity: 0.5;
    transition: all 1s;
    -webkit-transition: all 1s;
}

.overlay-book button {
    animation: zoom-in-zoom-out 2s ease-out infinite;
    background: #fb4d00;
    text-transform: capitalize;
    font-weight: bold;
    font-size: 24px;
}
@keyframes zoom-in-zoom-out {
  0% {
    transform: scale(0.5, 0.5);
  }
  50% {
    transform: scale(0.9, 0.9);
  }
  100% {
    transform: scale(1, 1);
  }
}
a.bytn {

    font-family: 'Roboto';
}

.TourDates p {
    font-size: 16px;
}

ul.highlight-this-tour li:before {
    content: "\f191";
    font: normal 14px/1 FontAwesome;
    color: #444;
    display: inline-block !important;
    width: 1em;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0 5px 0 0;
    text-align: center;
    font-variant: normal;
    text-transform: none;
    line-height: 1em;
    position: relative;
}
h2.tourDBox {
    font-weight: bold;
}
.TourList {
    border-left: dashed 1px #d8d8d8;
    border-radius: 0px;
    float: left;
    width: 100%;
    position: relative;
}
.TourDates:first-child {
    margin-top: 0;
    padding-top: 0;
}
.TourDates {
    margin: 15px 0 15px 0px;
    padding-top: 10px;
    margin-left: 20px;
    border-bottom: 1px solid #d8d8d8;
    font-size: 16px;
    cursor: pointer;
    display: block;
    color: #1F2225;
    float: left;
    width: 98%;
}
.TourDay_details {
    float: left;
    width: 85%;
    letter-spacing: 0.5px;
    word-spacing: 0.8px;
    line-height: normal;
    font-size: 14px;
}
.TourDay {
    color: #c00100;
    margin-right: 10px;
    float: left;
}
.expBut {
    width: 26px;
    text-align: center;
    color: #061b30;
    height: 28px;
    line-height: 23px;
    float: right;
    margin-left: 5px;
    margin-bottom: 6px;
    cursor: pointer;
    text-align: center;
    font-weight: bold;
    float: right;
    font-size: 22px;
    padding: 0 4px;
    border-radius: 21px;
}
.TourList .TourInfo {
    margin-left: 0;
    padding: 0 0px 20px 20px;
    background-color: white;
    overflow: hidden;
}
.tour-overview p, .tour-collection p {
    text-align: justify;
}
.TourList::after {
    content: '';
    position: absolute;
    width: 18px;
    height: 18px;
    left: -11px;
    background-color: white;
    border: 2px solid #061b30;
    top: 0px;
    border-radius: 50%;
    z-index: 1;
}
.tour-collection {
    float: left;
    width: 100%;
}

.sidebar_section_col, .sidebar_section_col2 {
    margin: 0 0 15px 0;
    background: #fff;
	-webkit-box-shadow: 0 1px 5px 0 rgb(0 0 0 / 30%);
    box-shadow: 0 1px 5px 0 rgb(0 0 0 / 30%);
    margin-top: 20px;
}
.sidebar_section_col h3, .sidebar_section_col2 h3, .sidebar_section_col div {
    font-size: 20px;
    color: #fff;
    background: #061b30;
    margin: 0;
    padding: 10px;
    font-family: 'Roboto';
    font-weight: bold;
}
.sidebar_section_col ul li a {
    color: #000;
    padding: 6px 10px;
    display: block;
    text-decoration: none;
    font-size: 16px;
}
.sidebar_section_col ul li i {
    padding-right: 5px;
    color: #c00100;
    font-weight: bold;
}
.sidebar_section_col ul li.morepkg {
    background: #f1f3f2;
}
.sidebar_section_col ul li.morepkg a {
    color: #c00100;
    text-align: right;
    font-weight: bold;

<h1>Narmada Pushkaram Tour Package</h1>
<p><span><a href="/" title="Home">Home</a> » <a href="/india-tour-packages" title="India Tour Packages">India</a> » <a href="/madhya-pradesh-tour-packages" title="Madhya Pradesh Tour Packages">Madhya Pradesh</a> » <span class="breadcrumb_last" aria-current="page">Narmada Pushkaram Tour</span></span></p>

<div id="cmsmasters_row_673c3146c9c345_00280627" class="cmsmasters_row cmsmasters_color_scheme_default tourflexBox cmsmasters_row_top_default cmsmasters_row_bot_default cmsmasters_row_boxed">
<div id="tourflexBox2" class="cmsmasters_row_outer_parent">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_outer">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_inner">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_margin">
<div class="cmsmasters_column two_third">
<div class="custom_html tourIB1">
<div class="proGall"><iframe width="100%" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/gEK2Vrpyhk0?si=yJ0GPCDbEWhZXLnE" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" allowfullscreen loading="lazy"></iframe></div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB2">
<div class="tour-overview">
<h3><i class="fa fa-file"></i> Tour Overview</h3>
<p>Our handcrafted Narmada Pushkaralu Package gives you a chance to seek the blessings of Goddess Narmada and engage in various rituals that are bound to cleanse your soul. Narmada Pushkaralu is one of the most divine festivals wherein Narmada River is worshipped by the pilgrims. The river is believed to be sanctified by Lord Shiva’s divine presence. Narmada Pushkaralu is one of the most sacred periods in the Hindu religion when the devotees worship the river fervently, offering them a chance to cleanse their soul and attain spiritual awakening. It is believed that the Narmada River gets infused during this time with divine energy. This celebration involves various cultural events, rituals, and spiritual experiences that will satiate your craving for spirituality and bliss. Pushkaralu is celebrated every twelve years coinciding with the transit of Jupiter into specific zodiac signs. This has a great influence on which areas of the river are auspicious for rituals. As you embark on this spiritual journey you’ll take a dip in the holy water of River Narmada to wash away your sins and achieve salvation.</p>
<p>Book the Narmada Pushkaralu Package from our website to experience cultural celebration and religious fervor like never before. As your journey comes to an end you’ll experience spiritual renewal and get transformed into a better soul. The best thing about our packages is that you can customize them as per your preferences ensuring you can have the best experiences of your life. </p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB4">
<div class="tour-collection">
<h2 class="tourDBox"><i class="fa fa-bus" aria-hidden="true"></i> Tour Itinerary</h2>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details" id="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 1 :</span>Arrival at Amarkantak</p>
</p></div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="">
<p>On the first day of the tour, you will arrive at Amarkantak from Hyderabad via a picturesque road journey. During the road journey, you will pass through various ashrams, religious spots, and scenic destinations. Amarkantak is a famous Hindu pilgrimage site known as "Teerthraj" - "the king of pilgrimages". The city is known for its natural and geographical richness. It is the Satpura and Vindhya Ranges meeting point, with the Maikal Hills being the most popular site. After arriving at Amarkantak you will check in to your hotel and have a delightful overnight stay reflecting upon the experiences awaiting you.</p>
</p></div></div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 2 :</span>Narmada Kund exploration</p>
</p></div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Today you will have a tasty breakfast at your hotel and then head to the Narmada Kund, one of the holiest sites in India. Narmada is worshipped here as the mother goddess who nurtures the world. The Narmada is not the only river that originates here. Two other rivers, Johila and Son, also originate from Amarkantak. A grand aarti ceremony is organized at the bank of the Kund giving you a chance to have the greatest spiritual experiences. As you partake in the aarti ceremony you’ll feel enamored by the divinity of this place. You can also offer your prayers to Goddess Narmada and absorb the tranquil atmosphere. Head back to your hotel in the evening and have a relaxing sleep in your room post a lip-smacking dinner.</p>
</p></div></div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 3 :</span>Engage in various rituals, return to your hometown</p>
</p></div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Today you will wake up early in the morning and head to the Narmada Kund to engage in various rituals such as offering a Chunri and flowers to Goddess Narmada. You’ll also take a dip in the sacred waters of this river to abolish your sins and lead a pure life. See the pilgrims praying to the river and asking for forgiveness for the sins they have committed. Narmada Kund is considered to be the spot where the river Narmada emerges from the earth. You can also partake in various cultural and spiritual events that are organized around the river during the period of Pushkaralu. After the spiritual experience, you will say goodbye to Amarkantak and head back to your hometown.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
</div>

excerpt.rendered: Narmada Pushkaram Tour Package Home » India » Madhya Pradesh » Narmada Pushkaram Tour Tour Overview Our handcrafted Narmada Pushkaralu Package gives you a chance to seek the blessings of Goddess Narmada and engage in various rituals that are bound to cleanse your soul. Narmada Pushkaralu is one of the most divine festivals wherein Narmada...
